column1: As Co-Chairman of the International Religious Freedom Caucus I am proud to recognize this important day and of the work we are doing to end the persecution around the globe of those who are simply exercising the basic human right of religious freedom. https://t.co/3ti5gfFcDs

The December Jobs Report contained good news for all Americans.  We have maintained record low #unemployment rates- showing that our economy is strong.  This doesn’t happen by accident but rather is the result of targeted policies designed to spur growth. https://t.co/7gJSls95df
While we are making progress even one homeless Veteran is one too many.  I will keep fighting until we put an end to homelessness in the Veteran community. https://t.co/bwJXbMzfeE

The December #JobsReport contained good news for all Americans.  Wages are up 2.9%!  We must continue to support policies that create #jobs and boost prosperity for all Americans. https://t.co/yLTzD0lxAY
These treatments can be the difference between life and death and I am proud that our new law fixes the problem and ensures access. https://t.co/azCt9w2aFU

It will ensure patients in need of bone marrow or stem cell transplants have access to lifesaving treatment. For older Americans with blood cancers – like leukemia lymphoma and Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS) limited treatment options have been devastating.

ICYMI- As co-Chair of the Congressional Caucus to Cure Blood Cancers and Other Blood Disorders I have been increasingly focused on cell transplant issues.  A bill I coauthored the Patient Access to Cellular Transplant (PACT) Act was recently signed into law.

It is great to see that Florida’s unprecedented economic growth is forecasted to continue.  We must continue to support policies that create a climate in which small businesses can thrive. https://t.co/6mHLSLZNNE
I am glad the Ridge Road Extension project is finally permitted and under construction! https://t.co/Sduoz37w09
Learn more about becoming a mentor today by visiting the website below. https://t.co/karMTOqZSW #MentorIRL @MENTORnational

January is National #MentoringMonth a time to recognize the value of mentoring relationships & the mentors who make a difference in the lives of youth. I’m proud to recognize the many mentors in our state who help support young people every day!
Click below to watch my exchange with the expert panelist as we discuss the need for this important bill. https://t.co/IQGIkHQunc

One of the bills contemplated during the hearing the BENES Act is legislation I co-authored which will streamline the Medicare enrollment process to ensure patients are aware of their healthcare options.
During this week’s Healthcare Subcommittee hearing we discussed several bills designed to improve healthcare outcomes for Americans.

Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. A special thank you to all the law enforcement officers in Tampa Bay. Your day-to-day tireless and often thankless efforts make our community stronger and safer. Not just today but every day I am grateful for you. https://t.co/Iohgb9JdVx

I met w. the President and PM of Greece to discuss the mutually-beneficial strategic partnership btw the U.S. and Greece.  Greece has been a strong U.S. ally and a stabilizing force in a difficult part of the world. I'm optimistic we can continue to build upon this partnership. https://t.co/2zW0vqtFbd
January is Human Trafficking Awareness and Prevention month.  Please watch this brief video to learn more about this horrific form of modern-day slavery. https://t.co/yJLgQS1MDa
https://t.co/fs29bcmeu9

ICYMI- My bipartisan bill to help patients suffering with blood cancers was recently signed into law.  It was the 8th bill I co-authored to become law in 2019.  I look forward to continuing my work to put the needs of patients first when I return to Washington this week.

Particularly when it comes to doing the right thing for patients and for our nation’s heroes I will continue to reach across the aisle and be the hardest working member of Congress to  get things done for my constituents!

I am proud of what we have accomplished and appreciate being recognized in a Vanderbilt University study as being the most effective legislator in the State of Florida. I have always been a consensus builder regardless of which party was in power or what distractions may exist.
My team and I have been hard at work throughout 2019 to advance solutions that solve the problems facing our nation and community. https://t.co/iJu8JAY11E
https://t.co/tze90ZlcOo

These new increases are unacceptable. We have bipartisan bicameral legislation (HR 19) waiting to be brought to the House Floor. It would be signed into law right away and provide relief to Americans by lowering drug prices. I urge the Speaker to bring H.R. 19 to a vote.
@pascoschools These students are indeed truly Outstanding.  Congratulations!

These increases are unacceptable. We have a bipartisan solution. It would be signed into law right away and provide immediate relief to Americans by lowering drug prices now. Stop playing partisan games and bring H.R. 19 to a vote.  https://t.co/Bfh8GVOzqE

My hope is that during this year we will continue to make progress on legislation to ensure all Veterans have access to the care and benefits they have earned and deserve – a priority for Dr. Roe and me. (4/4)
Specifically I am most proud of the MISSION Act which ensures our heroes receive the best possible care and the Forever GI Bill which protects the educational benefits of Veterans for life. (3/4)

Dr. Roe is a true patriot and has been a wonderful friend to me as we endeavored to advocate for and improve the lives of our nation’s heroes.  I am proud of the monumental achievements we have made on behalf of Veterans with him at the helm of the VA Committee. (2/4)

While I am saddened to learn that my friend and long-time colleague will no longer be serving in the House after this term I do wish him all the best in his well-deserved retirement. https://t.co/DctHGacnQx (1/4)

My hope is that during this year we will continue to make progress on legislation to ensure all Veterans have access to the care and benefits they have earned and deserve – a priority for Dr. Roe and me.
Specifically Im most proud of the MISSION Act which ensures our heroes receive the best possible care and the Forever GI Bill to protect the educational benefits of Veterans for life.

Dr. Roe is a true patriot and has been a wonderful friend to me as we endeavored to advocate for and improve the lives of our nation’s heroes.  I am proud of the monumental achievements we have made on behalf of Veterans with him at the helm of the VA Committee.
(continued) Our enemies should know without question that anyone who targets our brave Americans around the globe will be brought to justice. https://t.co/wGZHbSSYmD 3/3

(continued) Soleimani was responsible for the killings of countless American soldiers and whose future imminent attacks against the U.S. were thwarted by this strike. I commend the President and the members of our military who carried out this mission.  2/3
While I am certainly concerned with escalating violence in the Middle East I believe we must use whatever force is necessary to protect American lives. 1/3
I'm glad to see the Dept. of Defense do the right thing in this matter. https://t.co/h47UKq9SXT
@tarafhunter Thanks for letting me know.  I'll check on it.
#MoreCures https://t.co/8dFEGkWpJO

I support H.R. 19 in honor of Lincoln Deluna a six year old little boy from Wesley Chapel who is battling a rare disease with no cure. He and all the millions of Americans who face similar circumstances deserve access to innovative treatments. #MoreCures https://t.co/zlVkcFpXjT

Shayne is an integral member of my team who works tirelessly alongside me on critical issues that will improve health outcomes for all Americans. He always seeks to empower patients and give a voice at the table to those who need it most.  Congratulations Shayne!

A special shout out to my Senior Policy Advisor Shayne Woods who earned a Rare Voice award by the Rare Disease Legislative Advocates Association for his outstanding advocacy on behalf of patients who suffer with a rare disease.  https://t.co/him2S8Do5x

I’m excited that my constituents from @TECOEnergy will have the opportunity showcase their creative work that has led to the company’s designation as an Environmental Champion for the last five years in a row.  #InnovatEandC

Today’s Energy & Environment Innovation Showcase will highlight the importance of investing in the development and deployment of breakthrough technologies to reduce emissions power the economy of tomorrow and provide greater value to American consumers. https://t.co/PmXK8tZEIh

My team had the pleasure of spending time with Gold Star families this weekend. We will never forget their loved ones or the ultimate sacrifice they made in defense of our freedom. It's great to see the community showing support for these families during their annual picnic. https://t.co/uMqjOpyEx3

I'm glad it all worked out and hope you were able to enjoy a nice holiday. I do have an amazing team available to help constituents interface with federal agencies. We are here to help! https://t.co/ING8ltJLiT
@DannyBurgessFL Wishing a wonderful birthday to an amazing woman!
The work to protect our nation’s heroes must remain bipartisan. https://t.co/ZK52PHT1bz
For more social media updates from our office like our Facebook Page from the link below!   https://t.co/iIA7xXrzcr

Yesterday my BRAND USA reauthorization bill passed out of E&C. Brand USA has a proven track record of increasing tourism to the US w/o using any tax dollars. Tourism is such an important part of our state’s economy and I want to be sure that this successful program continues! https://t.co/P7IjR4ivAJ

We are working to eliminate suicides within the Veteran community. While we took an important legislative step this week Veterans in need of immediate care do not need to wait. If you or a Veteran you know needs assistance please reach out.  You’re not alone. Help is available. https://t.co/aKlfnvoW9V

This week my team had the pleasure of participating in the grand opening of the Bayonet Point Wound Care Center.  I am confident many patients will get great care at this new facility.  Welcome to the neighborhood! https://t.co/kjNIetQb9U

During this week's VA Committee hearing we discussed the spread of false info on social media targeting the Veteran community. We want to work in a bipartisan fashion to ensure that those who prey upon our heroes are stopped and held accountable. https://t.co/UIalKuYQyD

My team was honored to help celebrate the 100th birthday of one of my constituents Cosimo A. DePietto. Captain DePietto served in World War II.  Thank you for your service and a very Happy Birthday sir! https://t.co/h3zzvVPnHx

As someone who flies weekly I know @FlyTPA deserves this recognition. Lopano & team work hard to maintain a customer-centered experience ensuring accessibility while allowing for the expansion necessary to boost tourism & enhance options for travelers. https://t.co/3m6Dbg616g
Additionally I will remember that one small act of kindness can make a tremendous difference in someone else's life.  I challenge each of us to be that difference!

I will continue to treat all of my constituents and colleagues with kindness whether we agree on the issues of the day or not. I will make a conscious choice to find areas of agreement and to build upon them.

It is also important to remember that we can disagree vehemently about political issues but still be kind and civil to one another.  Thank you for the privilege of serving as your representative in Washington.

Today is World Kindness Day.  In a time when there appears to be deep divisions in our country we should be mindful of the fact that what unites us as Americans is greater than our differences. https://t.co/GivNUB1dbV

Locally the agency reports that Pasco County saw a 57% reduction between 2018-2019 and Hillsborough County saw a 12.9% reduction. We are making progress however even one homeless Veteran is one too many. I will continue my work to eradicate veteran homelessness.

Today the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development announced a 2% decrease in the number of homeless Veterans throughout the nation between 2018-2019 which reflects an approximate 50% reduction since 2009.
Reducing the number of homeless Veterans in America has been a priority of mine since joining Congress. https://t.co/V6cYFWKvTo

... by giving states the option of covering pregnant and postpartum women for a year instead of 60 days. These bipartisan bills demonstrate our commitment to continue addressing maternal mortality and improving the health outcomes in mothers across the country.

... health professionals and authorizes grants for operating innovative evidence-based programs that deliver integrated services to pregnant and postpartum women. The Helping MOMS Act enhances coverage for pregnant and postpartum women in the Medicaid and SCHIP programs...

We built off that essential work by passing two bipartisan bills in today’s Health Subcommittee mark-up hearing. The Maternal Health Quality Improvement Act authorizes grants to identify develop and disseminate maternal health quality best practices supports training for...

This important law improved data collection and reporting regarding maternal mortality.  It also developed systems at the local state and national levels to better understand the burden of maternal complications.

This is significantly higher than many other developed countries. The Health Subcommittee began investing this growing problem several years ago and last year the President signed the Preventing Maternal Deaths Act into law.

Creating healthy families starts with ensuring the health and well-being of expectant mothers. According to the Centers for Disease Control about 700 women die each year in the U.S. as a result of pregnancy or delivery complications. https://t.co/3sxw562XBk

My team and I participated in several events this past weekend celebrating the sacrifices our Veterans and their families make in defense of our freedom. It is wonderful to see so many young people learning about the important contributions these heroes have made to our nation. https://t.co/f15FferP3n

Enes Kanter shared the harrassment he has suffered at the hands of Erdogan's bullying. Though feet apart in height Kanter and I see eye to eye. I'll ensure his voice is not silenced as he speaks truth to power. Edrogan doesn't deserve the ear of the President. #shortgreek https://t.co/2AeUPVvTMG
Proud to support each of these including my bill to protect Veterans' educational benefits. https://t.co/izsbTRsGwN

If you are a Veteran in need of dental care please contact my office today to register for Stars Stripes and Smiles in New Port Richey tomorrow. Cleanings fillings and extractions will be provided free of charge to Veterans in need! Book your appointment today! https://t.co/NJS4x0lRnw
The system will be randomly dialing constituents; however if you want to ensure your participation you can call in directly at 1-888-480-3641.

This is just one of the multiple ways that I communicate with my constituents on a regular basis. I look forward to the opportunity to provide a brief update of what I have been working on in Washington and answer your questions.

On Monday night (November 4 2019) at 6:00 p.m. I will be hosting a tele-town hall. This forum allows a maximum number of constituents to participate. On average several thousand constituents join in each tele-town hall for the entire hour-long exchange.

Earlier today SAMHSA announced the launch of a website to help connect Americans looking for substance abuse treatment with approximately 13000 treatment locations across the nation.  This is one important step as we seek to improve access to care. https://t.co/XDo4QPE8pq
and other ethnic and religious minorities were killed by the Ottoman Empire and the United States will no longer let this historic inaccuracy stand.” (5/5)

Therefore I am proud that the United States set the historic record straight by officially recognizing the Armenian Genocide. Turkey has for too long denied the historic fact that 1.5 million Armenians (4/5)

but conveniently forgets that the Turkish military was the one that initially fenced off Varosha and continues to this day to prevent the lawful internationally recognized inhabitants of the city to return to their homes. It seems like Turkey needs a history lesson. (3/5)

To all my fellow Rays’ fans who will be watching tonight’s game…Don’t stop believing! https://t.co/RyPaCalT5h
Today Cyprus celebrates the 59th anniversary of the day it won its independence.  I look forward to the day when the entire country is fully reunified and free from all foreign occupation.

This week is #nationalcleanenergyweek! I recently worked with @CCE_Florida to tour Covanta Pasco an energy-from-waste facility. I’m excited to be taking part in the clean energy movement and to continue discussing ways our state can diversify our energy sources! #NCEW19
